intro: Leptanthus ovalis, commonly known as the oval leaf leptanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
